init.title: Ness Alarm Options
init.description: Adjust settings for your Ness alarm panel.

data_description.scan_interval: Time interval between updates in seconds
data_description.infer_arming_state: Infer the disarmed arming state only via system status events. This works around a bug with some panels (version less than 5.8) which emit empty status updates when they are armed
data_description.enabled_zones: Number of zones to enable. Zones beyond this number will be disabled but can be manually re-enabled. Use this to override auto-detection or if you have zone expanders.

aux.name: Aux
aux.description: Changes the state of an aux output.

output_id.name: Output ID
output_id.description: The aux output you wish to change.

state.name: State
state.description: The on/off state of the output. If P14xE 8E is enabled then turning on will pulse the output for the time specified in P14(x+4)E.

code.name: Code
code.description: The user code to use to trigger the panic alarm.

yaml_config_imported.title: YAML Configuration Successfully Imported
yaml_config_imported.description:
The Ness Alarm integration has been successfully imported from your YAML configuration and is now managed through the UI.

**Imported Configuration:**
- Host: {host}
- Port: {port}
- Panel: {panel_model} (v{panel_version})
- Zones: {zone_count} configured

**Next Steps:**
1. Remove the `ness_alarm:` section from your `configuration.yaml` file
2. Restart Home Assistant to complete the migration

You can manage this integration at **Settings → Devices & Services → Ness Alarm**
